column3: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
Man becomes great exactly in the degree in which he works for the welfare of his fellow-men.

To my young friends out there: Life can be great, but not when you can't see it. So, open your eyes to life: to see it in the vivid colors that God gave us as a precious gift to His children, to enjoy life to the fullest, and to make it count. Say yes to your life.
The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
Beware of little expenses. A small leak will sink a great ship.
Silence is one of the great arts of conversation.
There are two powers in the world; one is the sword and the other is the pen. There is a great competition and rivalry between the two. There is a third power stronger than both, that of the women.
If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
The price of greatness is responsibility.

I feel like life is really short, and it's important to enjoy yourself and embrace whatever comes your way, whether it's a challenging day or a great day, just welcome it with open arms. No matter who you are, you can't escape challenges; they are part of life.
I like to listen. I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen.
I'm surrounded by great friends and family. I don't know what I would do without them.
Step with care and great tact, and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.
The three great essentials to achieve anything worth while are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.
My only fault is that I don't realize how great I really am.
Nothing great in the world has ever been accomplished without passion.
Great acts are made up of small deeds.
I have a great relationship with the Mexican people.

God and Nature first made us what we are, and then out of our own created genius we make ourselves what we want to be. Follow always that great law. Let the sky and God be our limit and Eternity our measurement.
My passion and great enjoyment for architecture, and the reason the older I get the more I enjoy it, is because I believe we - architects - can effect the quality of life of the people.

Parents and schools should place great emphasis on the idea that it is all right to be different. Racism and all the other 'isms' grow from primitive tribalism, the instinctive hostility against those of another tribe, race, religion, nationality, class or whatever. You are a lucky child if your parents taught you to accept diversity.
Character may be manifested in the great moments, but it is made in the small ones.

Band members have a special bond. A great band is more than just some people working together. It's like a highly specialized army unit, or a winning sports team. A unique combination of elements that becomes stronger together than apart.
You can't build a great building on a weak foundation. You must have a solid foundation if you're going to have a strong superstructure.
